item.title: iPhone 4
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Well no, the iPhone has a mainstream appeal that Android phones have not even touched yet. The vast majority don’t give a shit about the operating system being open source or not being able to run flash, they care if the phone has good functionality, has good support, will have no problems being updated (like Android phones do) and of course is nice to use.

The iPhone is best in class for usability (and you can read all the major tech sites for confirmation on that, but really it is an opinion), consistency and has the most application support.

The words “only a fanboy would buy an iPhone” are only the words of a fanboy. You can bet that the iPhone would outsell that Droid X by millions (literally), actual fanboys (not your definition of someone liking something you don’t) are always of a minority, the sales far expand beyond that.
